item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Notes on OpenAI's new o1 chain-of-thought models (291 points | 150 comments)
2. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (296 points | 48 comments)
3. Does Your Startup Need Complex Cloud Infrastructure? (91 points | 58 comments)
4. Better-performing "25519" elliptic-curve cryptography (52 points | 7 comments)
5. Boeing workers vote to strike in resounding defeat for troubled company (72 points | 41 comments)
6. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (123 points | 49 comments)
7. Swimmable Cities (29 points | 12 comments)
8. Understanding Concurrency, Parallelism and JavaScript (27 points | 3 comments)
9. Questions about LLMs in Group Chats (24 points | 6 comments)
10. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1517 points | 1145 comments)
11. The Magnetic Field of the Milky Way (26 points | 4 comments)
12. Notepat • Aesthetic Computer (65 points | 19 comments)
13. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (70 points | 27 comments)
14. Who Owns Nebula? (63 points | 6 comments)
15. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (59 points | 12 comments)
16. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
17. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (745 points | 349 comments)
18. Entire staff of game publisher Annapurna Interactive has reportedly resigned (8 points | 1 comment)
19. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (158 points | 85 comments)
20. Interview Learnings from Former CIA Intelligence Officer (31 points | 9 comments)
21. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (233 points | 69 comments)
22. Advertising platform The Trade Desk is building its own smart TV OS (19 points | 8 comments)
23. Why Haskell? (339 points | 434 comments)
24. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (58 points | 6 comments)
25. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (77 points | 18 comments)
26. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (124 points | 89 comments)
27. What Does It Take to Run Shor's Algorithm on a Quantum Computer? (9 points | discuss)
28. If I could dissect a sauropod (121 points | 16 comments)
29. Wallops: A modern IRC client for classic Mac OS (30 points | 3 comments)
30. Greenland landslide caused freak wave that shook Earth for nine days (57 points | 9 comments)
